class.title: Building your first Couchbase Lite Xamarin.iOS app
class.description: Tutorial for building a Couchbase Lite app for an iOS device using Xamarin

introduction.paragraph: This tutorial shows you how to use Couchbase Lite in your Xamarin.iOS apps and includes instructions for getting started with both Xamarin Studio and Visual Studio development environments. This tutorial assumes you are familiar with developing software for iOS devices using Xamarin. If you are new to Xamarin.iOS development, take a look at the free developer guides in the Xamarin Developer Center before beginning to work with Couchbase Lite.

The tutorial walks through creating a simple Couchbase Lite app. By following the tutorial, you will learn how to create a new Couchbase Lite Xamarin.iOS app, create a database, and interact with the database by using basic CRUD (create, read, update, and delete) operations.

To make it easier to learn the basics and get started with Couchbase Lite, the program structure is highly simplified. In the HelloWorld example app, there is no additional UI and all code is placed in the ViewController class.
You can follow along with the tutorial and build the CouchbaseEvent app yourself, or you can download the CouchbaseEvent code from GitHub.
